item.title: From BAT to AsyncRAT
item.author: misthi0s
item.description: While perusing public samples from the Triage database, I stumbled across an interesting payload that was labelled as AsyncRAT. AsyncRAT is an open-source Remote Access Tool (or Trojan may be more apt) written in C#, so I was curious as to what the infection process would look like starting as a Windows Batch file. For anyone who wants to follow along, the sample on Triage can be found here. Initial Payload Upon first investigation, the batch file appears to be heavily obfuscated, but upon closer inspection, the behavior exhibited isn’t too difficult to interpret.
